title: Synthetic Recap
body:
SACRAMENTO — On a night where the rest of the league was put on notice, David Robinson delivered a performance for the ages. The Admiral didn't just lead his San Antonio Spurs to a 103-97 victory over the Sacramento Kings; he authored a masterpiece, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record 51 points to sink the Kings on their home floor.

From the opening tip, Robinson was unstoppable. He operated with a ruthless efficiency, scoring from every conceivable angle. The Kings, lacking an answer for his blend of power and finesse, could only watch as the seven-foot center dominated the painted area. Each spin move, each face-up jumper, and each authoritative dunk chipped away at Sacramento’s resolve, building a lead that, while challenged, would never truly be relinquished.

While Robinson’s historic scoring outburst rightfully commanded the spotlight, timely contributions from his teammates sealed the win. Sean Elliott chipped in 14 points, and Avery Johnson orchestrated the offense with 11 points and 10 assists, ensuring the offense ran through its dominant focal point. For the Kings, Mitch Richmond fought valiantly, scoring a team-high 28 points, but his effort was simply overshadowed by a force of nature in a Spurs uniform.

In the end, the scoreboard read 103-97, but this night belonged to one man. Robinson’s 51-point eruption wasn’t merely a winning effort; it was a historic statement, a legendary performance that will forever be etched in the annals of San Antonio Spurs lore.
